Recently refurbished throughout and arranged across some 2,560 sq ft including a private garage, it combines the feel of a modern townhouse with the ease of a low-maintenance London home. <PARA> The ground floor is arranged for everyday living and entertaining, with a newly fitted kitchen positioned at the front of the house and a dedicated dining room beyond. A guest cloakroom and the integral garage complete this level, making arrival and daily life notably straightforward for a central London address. <PARA> Upstairs, the first floor forms the main reception level, stretching across the full width of the house. Throughout, the design remains consistent, with pale wood floors, soft neutral tones and carefully considered lighting creating a sense of cohesion from floor to floor. <PARA> Set on Pavilion Road, one of Knightsbridge's most charming and characterful streets, the house sits moments from the boutiques, cafés and restaurants that line the road, with the green spaces of Hyde Park and the world-class shopping of Sloane Street and Brompton Road just beyond. It is a location that offers village-like charm at the centre of one of London's most prestigious neighbourhoods, making this a particularly appealing base for both full-time living and an elegant pied-à-terre.
